Independence he was also wearing a

under the new measures people convicted
of threatening security could face life
in prison Hong Kong's chief executive
Carrie Lam has described the new
security law as the most important
development since Britain handed back
the territory
at a ceremony marking the 23rd
anniversary of its handover she called
the law a turning point Western
governments have condemned the move as
an unprecedented assault on Hong Kong's
liberties and autonomy the national
security law only targets an extremely
small minority of people who commit
fraud types of crimes that seriously
threaten national security as provided
in the law namely secession subversion
of state power organization and carrying
out of terrorist activities and
collusion with foreign or external
forces to endanger national security it
serves to protect the life and property
basic rights and freedoms of the
overwhelming majority of our citizens
